section.p: You put ashore to take on fresh water. The crewmen are happy to cavort along the wide golden beach and explore the orchid scented jungle - until the ship’s priest comes staggering back with his throat slashed, gurgles ‘Iambic pentameter’ and dies at your feet.
‘Pentameter - that’s a sort of ship, like a quinquireme,’ says the first mate. ‘Iambic, though? Out of a port called Iambus? Where’s that?’
The rest of the shore party are spooked. They want to leave.
